title: Has the USA ever single-handedly won a war in the 20th century? - Quora
tags: Military History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: It will depend on how we define “war”. Some examples include: The Invasion of Panama. If there were any other countries’ forces involved they wouldn’t have mattered.The Invasion of Grenada. A sloppy win against tiny forces. Same as above – even if there were a few soldiers from allied countries, it wouldn’t have mattered.Possibly the Pacific Theater in WWII, which you might call the War Against Japan. There were some British forces in the Pacific, and Australia helped, but it’s not clear if they decisively affected the outcome, especially since the war ended with American nuclear strikes on Japan. At the point where America had the nuclear bomb, their victory was assured and arguably single-handed (unless we focus on the non-Americans involved in developing the bomb).Arguably the Pancho Villa Expedition. This was America’s war against Mexican forces led by Pancho Villa in 1916 - 1917, after Villa’s forces attacked the town of Columbus, New Mexico. It was led by General Blackjack Pershing, and was an All-American mission. Villa was not captured, but his forces were neutralized and they were never able to attack the US again.The Gulf War, aka Desert Storm. This was definitely a coalition with lots of other countries, including major British and French forces, but the US didn’t really need that help to win, and it was the most spectacular American military victory of the 20th century. The Battle of 73 Easting was a clinic of destruction. The presence or absence of British forces wouldn’t have changed the outcome.

The United States, in order to appease world opinion, typically tries to involve other nations, even in the smallest possible ways, in order for a war to ::: not ::: appear to be some unilateral military action. The U.S. prefers a war at least appear to be that of an international coalition. This is for political and public consumption reasons.

All major wars in the 20th century were coalitions. Internal wars such as the Mexican Border War 1910–1919 and disturbances in the Philippines etc, hardly count as world peace threatening wars. So no, the USA has not.

The US rarely fights wars unilaterally and usually gets involved in conflicts because it is defending an ally or allies. The US engaged successfully in military operations a number of times against smaller countries and also did so against major combatants a number of times as well with allies.
The USA always fights with allies, unlike its opponents, like Saddam Hussein of Iraq. The USA may be the main fighting force, but it always has allies.
Yes, the USA single-handedly won its glorious conquest of the island nation of Grenada.
